  • Method Details

    • put

      boolean put(K key, E e)
      Attempts to add a new element associated with the given key to the pool.
      Parameters:
      key - The key with which the specified element is to be associated.
      e - The element to be added to the pool.
      Returns:
      true if the element was successfully added, false otherwise.

    • put

      boolean put(K key, E e, boolean autoDestroyOnFailedToPut)
      Attempts to add a new element associated with the given key to the pool. If the addition fails and autoDestroyOnFailedToPut is true, the element will be destroyed.
      Parameters:
      key - The key with which the specified element is to be associated.
      e - The element to be added to the pool.
      autoDestroyOnFailedToPut - If true, the element will be destroyed if it cannot be added to the pool.
      Returns:
      true if the element was successfully added, false otherwise.

    • get

      E get(K key)
      Retrieves the element associated with the given key from the pool.
      Parameters:
      key - The key whose associated element is to be returned.
      Returns:
      The element associated with the specified key, or null if the pool contains no mapping for the key.

    • remove

      E remove(K key)
      Removes the element associated with the given key from the pool.
      Parameters:
      key - The key whose associated element is to be removed.
      Returns:
      The element that was associated with the key, or null if the pool contained no mapping for the key.

    • peek

      E peek(K key)
      Retrieves the element associated with the given key from the pool without updating the last access time.
      Parameters:
      key - The key whose associated element is to be returned.
      Returns:
      The element associated with the specified key, or null if the pool contains no mapping for the key.

    • keySet

      Set<K> keySet()
      Retrieves a set of the keys contained in the pool.
      Returns:
      A set of the keys contained in the pool.

    • values

      Collection<E> values()
      Retrieves a collection of the values contained in the pool.
      Returns:
      A collection of the values contained in the pool.

    • containsKey

      boolean containsKey(K key)
      Checks if the pool contains an element associated with the given key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to be checked for presence in the pool.
      Returns:
      true if the pool contains an element associated with the specified key, false otherwise.
